line.token: * This file is part of Composer.

* file that was distributed with this source code.
/** @var ?string contents before modification if the lock file exists */
'Adds required packages to your composer.json and installs them.'
'Optional package name can also include a version constraint, e.g. foo/bar or foo/bar:1.0.0 or foo/bar=1.0.0 or "foo/bar 1.0.0"'
'Outputs the operations but will not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).'
'Forces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.'
'Forces installation from package dist|source|auto (auto chooses source for dev versions, dist for the rest).'
'DEPRECATED: This flag does not exist anymore.'
'Disables the automatic update of the dependencies (implies --no-install).'
'Skip the install step after updating the composer.lock file.'
'Run the dependency update with the --no-dev option.'
'Allows inherited dependencies to be updated, except those that are root requirements.'
'Allows all inherited dependencies to be updated, including those that are root requirements.'
'Ignore a specific platform requirement (php & ext- packages).'
'Sorts packages when adding/updating a new dependency'
'Autoload classes from the classmap only. Implicitly enables `--optimize-autoloader`.'
'Use a custom prefix for the APCu autoloader cache. Implicitly enables --apcu-autoloader'
The require command adds required packages to your composer.json and installs them.
If you do not specify a package, composer will prompt you to search for a package, and given results, provide a list of
If you do not specify a version constraint, composer will choose a suitable one based on the available package versions.
If you do not want to install the new dependencies immediately you can call it with --no-update
'<warning>You are using the deprecated option "--no-suggest". It has no effect and will break in Composer 3.</warning>'
// check for writability by writing to the file as is_writable can not be trusted on network-mounts
'<error>"--fixed" option is allowed for "project" package types only to prevent possible misuses.</error>'
'<error>If your package is not library, you should explicitly specify "type" parameter in composer.json.</error>'
// initialize $this->repos as it is used by the PackageDiscoveryTrait
'No composer.json present in the current directory ('
'), this may be the cause of the following exception.'
'<error>Root package \'%s\' cannot require itself in its composer.json</error>'
'%s is currently present in the %s key and you ran the command %s the --dev flag, which would move it to the %s key.'
'<info>Do you want to re-run the command %s --dev?</info> [<comment>yes</comment>]? '
// if no lock is present, or the file is brand new, we do not do a
// partial update as this is not supported by the Installer
'You can also try re-running composer require with an explicit version constraint, e.g. "composer require '
':*" to figure out if any version is installable, or "composer require '
':^2.1" if you know which you need.'
